command: bash -lc 'set -euo pipefail; ts=$(date -u +%FT%TZ); d=$(date -u +%F); dest=/opt/ti/closed/filings/$d; mkdir -p "$dest"; if scp -q -i /etc/ssh/keys/corpfilings_ed25519 -o StrictHostKeyChecking=yes -o UserKnownHostsFile=/etc/ssh/known_hosts_corpfilings -o IdentitiesOnly=yes filings@sftp.corporate-filings.ai:/private/sec_filings/acme_corp/latest.xml{,.sha256} "$dest"/ && (cd "$dest" && sha256sum -c latest.xml.sha256); then printf "{\"timestamp\":\"%s\",\"technique\":\"T1597\",\"source\":\"corporate-filings\",\"artifact\":\"%s/latest.xml\",\"status\":\"verified\"}\n" "$ts" "$dest" | tee -a /var/log/ti_fetch.json; else printf "{\"timestamp\":\"%s\",\"technique\":\"T1597\",\"source\":\"corporate-filings\",\"status\":\"error\"}\n" "$ts" >&2; fi'
explanation: Acquires aggregated, paywalled corporate filings (XML) from a subscription repository via SFTP, verifying integrity and logging in JSON for traceability per T1597.
rationale_steps: Establish a secure SFTP session to the filings aggregator.
Download the latest filings XML and checksum.
Validate checksum and archive in a date-specific directory.
Produce a JSON status message for reliable observability.
